definition: to be secretive; to try to cover up (idiom)
to cover up (a shortcoming)/to screen off/to hide/to conceal
to cover up (a shortcoming)/to screen off/to hide/to conceal
to cover up/to close/to surprise
to cover up/to close/to surprise

sentences.english: It's better to give bad news honestly than to try to sugarcoat it.
sentences.chinese: 诚实地公布坏消息要好过遮遮掩掩。

sentences.english: Love Your Belly Pose to emphasize your belly, not hide it.
sentences.chinese: 喜欢上你的肚子吧，重视它，别遮遮掩掩的。

sentences.english: The secrecy used to create the Manifesto has generated some unfriendly reactions around the web.
sentences.chinese: 宣言的遮遮掩掩在网上引起了一些很不友好的反应。

sentences.english: This country's affection is overwhelming and furtive.
sentences.chinese: 这个国度的爱势不可挡却又遮遮掩掩。

sentences.english: 'I don’t like hiding, ' she told Seventeen magazine.
sentences.chinese: 她告诉十七岁杂志“我不喜欢遮遮掩掩。”

sentences.english: You can't control, and revelation works better than concealment.
sentences.chinese: 你无法控制，而开诚布公比遮遮掩掩效果更好。

sentences.english: Was this a veiled begging letter?
sentences.chinese: 这是一封遮遮掩掩的化缘信吗？
